javadoc:
Iterator that visits each defined data instance in a Program or in the footprint of a specified data element.

Data elements that are nested inside of composites or arrays are visited, not just the parent/containing data element.

methods.name: byDataType
methods.comment:
Creates a new iterator that traverses the entire Program's address space, visiting
 data instances that successfully match the predicate.

params.name: dataTypePredicate
params.comment: Predicate that tests each data instance's DataType

methods.name: definedStrings
methods.comment: Creates a new iterator that traverses the entire Program's address space.

methods.name: definedStrings
methods.comment: Creates a new iterator that traverses a portion of the Program's address space.

params.name: addrs
params.comment: addresses to limit the iteration to

methods.name: definedStrings
methods.comment:
Creates a new iterator that traverses the address space of a single data item (ie. a
 composite or array data instance that needs to be recursed into).

name: DefinedDataIterator
comment:
Iterator that visits each defined data instance in a Program or in the footprint of
 a specified data element.
 
 Data elements that are nested inside of composites or arrays are visited, not just the
 parent/containing data element.
